passages.title: Follow-up
passages.content:
Dear Ms. Richter,

Thank you for coming to our office to interview for the assistant import manager position last week. We were impressed with your credentials and enthusiasm. [131] we are moving ahead with another candidate, we would like to offer you a different position that just became available: logistics coordinator.

The attached document contains the detailed job description and pay rate. This [132] has not yet been posted publicly. If you are [133] , please let me know by the end of this week.

Sincerely,
Watanu Sakamoto
Human Resource Manager, RHN Imports

options.label: A
options.text: There are several other internal applicants.

options.label: B
options.text: Unfortunately, the position is no longer available.

options.label: C
options.text: My assistant will schedule your second interview.

options.label: D
options.text: Your experience and skill set make you a great fit.

passages.content:
The Oakville Horticulture Club [135] a plant sale on Saturday, 9 September. The sale will be held from 9:00 A.M. to 4:00P.M. at the Oakville Community Centre at 478 Hill Avenue. There will be great deals on hanging baskets, grasses, and herbs. [136] We [137] have a delicious selection of fruits and vegetables available for purchase. Enjoy live talks and demonstrations [138] the day. For more information, visit the Oakville Horticulture Web site:
www.oakvillehorticultureclub.co.uk/events.

options.label: A
options.text: Come early to get the best selection.

options.label: B
options.text: Plants help make your home beautiful.

options.label: C
options.text: Join the club for a discount on local garden tours.

options.label: D
options.text: The community center was just renovated.

passages.content:
July 2

Dear Mr. Arakaki:

I am writing to inform you of scheduled road maintenance on Briggs Avenue. Beginning on July 15, Briggs Avenue [139] reduced to one lane from Elm Street to Bay Road. [140] Although your [141] is not located in this section of Briggs Avenue, traffic on most of the street will move more slowly than usual while work is being performed. You may [142] consider advising your employees to take alternate routes to work during this time. The project is expected to be completed on or before October 22. Thank you for your cooperation and assistance.

Sincerely,
Amalia Villalobos
Director of Transportation
Enclosure

options.label: A
options.text: Briggs Avenue is only two miles away.

options.label: B
options.text: The event will take place on Elm Street.

options.label: C
options.text: Please refer to the enclosed map of the affected area.

options.label: D
options.text: However, all city services will close during this time.

passages.title: Franklin Planetarium to Move Downtown
passages.content:
(June 3)-After 48 years in its present location on Mayfield's south side, the Franklin Planetarium is moving to a new home. Construction is underway on the downtown facility, part of a complex that includes the new Natural History Museum. Both [143] are expected to open to the public next September.

The current planetarium's main attraction is a 300-seat theater, where visitors can view projections of stars and planets on the dome above. [144] a larger theater, the new planetarium will feature an upgraded digital projection system. [145] Visitors will be able [146] the night sky more clearly and explore other planets and galaxies through new, interactive displays.

options.label: A
options.text: There are currently three other museums in the Mayfield area.

options.label: B
options.text: Attendance at the planetarium has been up in recent years.

options.label: C
options.text: Planning for the new planetarium began five years ago.

options.label: D
options.text: There will be room for three short-term exhibits as well.
